comment: Wow, I am super surprised by how low everyone is rating Lartigue.  Lartigue is by far one of the best professors I've taken.  He's strict and expects a lot out of his students, much more than what normal teachers expect.  But its because he pushes his students so hard that his classes are so helpful.  If you take Lartigue you'll definitely learn.

DO NOT TAKE UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES. He is completely draconian about attendance, classwork and project work, his workload is completely overkill by any standard, he can have a very bad temper over very minor things, and even his big group project is outside of the scope of the class BY HIS OWN UNWITTING ADMISSION. AVOID AT ANY AND ALL COSTS.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: You will learn everything about documentation in this class but nothing about how to do anything. Once the coding and website design portion come around you are on your own and the only help will probably be internet searches and youtube videos. Unless you have prior knowledge in full deatil of everything required you are going to struggle in class
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Disrespectful to students. His lectures are not structured and lack content. Tries to make up for it by making students study for an unreasonable amount of time on homework and projects. Unclear on expectations for those. Actually good at teaching SWE, by bringing the shenanigans of the tech world right in the classroom. But not a good teacher.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He's very tough, but very helpful. Just read the book and take notes and you're golden. You know actually study. Want an easy A? not for you. Want to actually learn something? Take him.

He is VERY smart and knows his stuff, but he is very hard and unforgiving. He is very arrogant and gets upset/angry very easily. If you are fine with lots of reading, are good at brown-nosing, and can handle lots of work, you should be fine.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: The professor assigns huge group projects with massive documentation requirements, and after a section of the project is submitted, will change his mind about one of the requirements for that section and dock you points if you didn't read his mind and do it anyway. Very unclear instructions, changing constantly even after work completed.
Run, I have a 3.35 GPA. If you want to have nightmares of this professor, not be able to sleep, and run down your good GPA take him go for it. Worse professor of SPSU/KSU.

This is the best professor I have ever had. The course is not easy it is like you are working in a real professional environment so expect difficulties. I am working now for Apple and I am everyday amazed by how fast I am programming. my coworkers are impressed by my work and let me tell you it is all because of this lecturer.

Arguably the best professor I have come across in my CS coursework.  You will need to work hard but you will learn more in his class than any other.  Group projects and lengthy documentation are required.  If you are looking for an easy A go back to community college.  If he sees effort, he will curve.

Lartigue what can  say about him? This class he makes you actually learn the material with weekly quizzes every week on material and his projects are long and you will be spending numerous hours doing them and his tests are pretty reasonable to a certain extent but if there is another professor I would take him/her cause time is an issue.

He is fairly strict on grading, and expects a lot of work from students. I learned more from his class than anyone I have spoken to that took other professors. As long as you put in effort, and always show up to class you will do well. He curves final grades. He also offers extra credit/bonus opportunities on all test quizzes and projects

Spent between 30-60 hours on each of the six projects. Then an additional 2-3 hours for each chapter because of the weekly quizzes that went over the book even though they had not been covered yet.  Midterm and Final very difficult, with Final being 40% of grade.  If you can devote the time you can manage an A or B and really know your stuff.

Overall, you will learn but its hard. Expects 12+ hours a week. Very long projects, quizzes before he covers the material, test "impossible to get a 100." Expects you to treat it as a full time job. However, he knows his stuff & I have learned more in here than any other class. Need an easy A, not for you. Wanna learn and struggle for a C, take it.
avoid at all costs. Expectations are unrealistic. Class had little guidance and required way too much work for an elective.
